title: Human Body Systems and Their Interactions

vocab.definition: A group of organs that work together to perform specific functions
The system that transports blood, nutrients, and oxygen throughout the body
The system responsible for breathing and gas exchange
The body's ability to maintain stable internal conditions
A structure made of different tissues that work together for a specific function

teachingNotes: Emphasize how body systems work together and depend on each other. Use diagrams to show system interactions. Discuss how the body maintains homeostasis.

sample.question: What is the body's ability to maintain stable internal conditions called?

truefalse.question: The circulatory and respiratory systems work together to deliver oxygen to cells.

multiplechoice.question: Which system is responsible for breaking down food?

fillintheblank.question: A group of organs that work together is called a body ________.

shortanswer.question: How do the circulatory and respiratory systems work together?
expectedAny: lungs add oxygen to blood, heart pumps it
respiratory provides oxygen, circulatory transports it
